services.name: AI-Powered Root Cause Analysis
services.overview: This service utilizes machine learning to analyze sensor data and event logs from automated manufacturing systems, identifying the underlying causes of production downtime. It addresses the challenge of pinpointing the root cause of failures in complex systems, which often leads to prolonged downtime and reduced production efficiency. By training an AI model on historical data, the service detects patterns and anomalies that precede failures, providing specific insights into potential causes. This enables plant managers, maintenance engineers, and automation specialists to proactively address issues, reduce downtime, and lower maintenance costs. The system continuously learns and adapts to new data, improving its accuracy and effectiveness over time. The core value proposition is to transform reactive maintenance into a proactive, data-driven process, significantly improving operational uptime.
problems_addressed: Prolonged downtime due to difficulty in pinpointing the root cause of failures.
Reactive maintenance practices leading to unexpected production stoppages.
High maintenance costs associated with troubleshooting complex automated systems.
Lack of visibility into the interdependencies of system components and their impact on overall performance.
Inefficient use of maintenance resources due to manual data analysis and guesswork.
core_features: Anomaly Detection – Identifies unusual patterns in sensor data and event logs that may indicate potential failures. This feature uses time series analysis and statistical methods to flag deviations from normal operating conditions.

Root Cause Identification – Pinpoints the specific component or process that is causing the failure, providing detailed explanations and supporting evidence. This feature leverages machine learning algorithms to correlate events and sensor readings with known failure modes.

Predictive Maintenance Recommendations – Generates recommendations for preventive maintenance based on the predicted likelihood of failure. This feature uses predictive modeling techniques to forecast when components are likely to fail and suggests maintenance tasks to mitigate the risk.

Real-time Monitoring Dashboard – Provides a real-time view of system performance, highlighting potential issues and displaying key performance indicators (KPIs). The dashboard includes interactive visualizations, alerts, and reporting tools.
Historical Data Analysis – Enables users to analyze historical data to identify trends, patterns, and recurring issues. This feature provides tools for data exploration, filtering, and aggregation.
user_journeys: A manufacturing plant experiences frequent line stoppages. The AI identifies a faulty sensor that's causing the control system to trigger emergency shutdowns. The user logs into the dashboard, sees the anomaly alert, reviews the root cause analysis, and dispatches a maintenance technician to replace the sensor. After the replacement, the system confirms normal operation, and downtime is minimized.
ai_capabilities: Time series analysis for anomaly detection using algorithms like ARIMA, LSTM, or Prophet.
Machine learning classification models (e.g., Random Forest, Gradient Boosting) to identify root causes based on sensor data and event logs.
Predictive maintenance using regression models or survival analysis to estimate the remaining useful life (RUL) of components.

Model selection notes: For anomaly detection, consider LSTM if dealing with complex temporal dependencies. For root cause classification, Random Forest is robust and interpretable. For predictive maintenance, survival analysis is appropriate if you have time-to-failure data. Fine-tuning may be required to optimize performance on specific datasets. Use embeddings for semantic analysis of log data.

input_data_types: Sensor data (temperature, pressure, vibration, flow rate, etc.)
Event logs (system events, error messages, operator actions)
Production data (output volume, cycle time, defect rates)
data_schema_recommendations: Event Logs: timestamp (TIMESTAMP), event_id (VARCHAR), severity (VARCHAR), message (TEXT)
Maintenance Records: timestamp (TIMESTAMP), component_id (VARCHAR), repair_type (VARCHAR), cost (FLOAT)
Production Data: timestamp (TIMESTAMP), product_id (VARCHAR), quantity (INTEGER), defect_rate (FLOAT)
data_sources: Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) systems
data_requirements.privacy_and_compliance: Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) and industry-specific standards (e.g., FDA regulations for pharmaceutical manufacturing).

required_integrations: Ticketing systems (e.g., Jira, ServiceNow) for maintenance requests
integration_plan.authentication_strategy: OAuth 2.0 for secure access to external systems. JWT for internal API authentication. Consider Clerk/Auth0 for user management and authentication.

technical_specifications.architecture: The architecture consists of a data ingestion layer, a data processing and storage layer, an AI model training and inference layer, and a user interface layer. The data ingestion layer collects data from various sources and transforms it into a standardized format. The data processing and storage layer stores the data in a database and performs data cleaning and preprocessing. The AI model training and inference layer trains machine learning models on the historical data and uses these models to predict failures and identify root causes. The user interface layer provides a real-time monitoring dashboard and tools for analyzing historical data.

recommended_tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14 App Router, TailwindCSS, shadcn/ui, Vercel conventions
recommended_tech_stack.backend: Node.js / Next.js server actions / Vercel serverless functions
recommended_tech_stack.database: Planetscale / Supabase / PostgreSQL with schema notes
recommended_tech_stack.storage: Supabase storage / AWS S3 / Vercel Blob
recommended_tech_stack.AI: OpenAI API, embeddings, vector DB (Pinecone/Supabase vectors)

API_design: GET /sensors – Returns a list of sensors and their current status.
GET /events – Returns a list of events and their details.
POST /analyze – Analyzes sensor data and event logs to identify root causes. Payload: {start_time: TIMESTAMP, end_time: TIMESTAMP, sensor_ids: [VARCHAR], event_ids: [VARCHAR]}
GET /recommendations – Returns predictive maintenance recommendations. Payload: {component_id: VARCHAR}
POST /feedback - Allows users to provide feedback on the accuracy of the root cause analysis. Payload: {analysis_id: VARCHAR, is_correct: BOOLEAN, notes: TEXT}
frontend_components: Real-time Monitoring Dashboard – Displays key performance indicators (KPIs) and potential issues.
Root Cause Analysis View – Provides detailed explanations of identified root causes.
Predictive Maintenance Recommendations – Lists recommended maintenance tasks.
Historical Data Analysis Tools – Enables users to explore and analyze historical data.

deployment_instructions: Environment variables: OPENAI_API_KEY, DB_URL, SCADA_API_KEY, MES_API_URL
Vercel deployment: Configure GitHub repository for automatic deployment. Set environment variables in Vercel project settings.

pricing_strategy: SaaS subscription tiers based on the number of sensors monitored and the frequency of data analysis.
Usage-based pricing for access to advanced features and analytics.
Per-seat pricing for user access to the platform.
customer_segments: Large enterprises with complex automated systems

success_metrics: Accuracy of root cause identification (percentage of correct diagnoses).
Adoption rate of predictive maintenance recommendations (percentage of recommendations implemented).
User engagement (number of active users, frequency of use).
